title: STRY0001: Create Contact Entry Page
iWantTo: Have a page where I can enter a person's contact information
soThat: I can easily and quickly add the contact information for someone I meet
acceptanceCriteria: The blank page has been created in UI Builder under the U&I Conference notes Workspace experience.

title: STRY0002: Create page layout for Contact Entry Page
iWantTo: Have an easy and intuitive user interface and page layout
soThat: I can navigate the page and functions of this application without frustration or hindrances
acceptanceCriteria: Create a page layout that is easy to use, feel free to get as creative as you'd like. You can do as much design or as little design as you want.
hints:
• It is recommended that for the fields you will be creating on this page in the following stories, you don't use the "Form" component. Instead, use input field components of the appropriate type. It will require you to create more configuration for all of that to work how you want it to work, but the Form component is more complex to use for this use case.
  • You might end up trying to use the Form component to do this, and that's ok! Give it a shot and figure out how it works, it's still a valid way to execute on this story. But if you get stuck, just go back to the previously suggested approach.

title: STRY0003: Add "Name" Field to Contact Entry Page
iWantTo: Fill in fields on a form
soThat: I can enter the contact's name
acceptanceCriteria: The Contact Entry Page includes a "Name" field (string field, required).

title: STRY0004: Add "Email" Field to Contact Entry Page
iWantTo: Add an "Email" field to the form
soThat: I can enter the contact's email address
acceptanceCriteria: The Contact Entry Page includes an "Email" field (string field, required, with email format validation).

title: STRY0005: Add "Note" Field to Contact Entry Page
iWantTo: Add a "Note" field to the form
soThat: I can enter notes about the contact
acceptanceCriteria: The Contact Entry Page includes a "Note" field (string field, required).

title: STRY0006: Add "Phone Number" Field to Contact Entry Page
iWantTo: Add a "Phone Number" field to the form
soThat: I can enter the contact's phone number
acceptanceCriteria: The Contact Entry Page includes a "Phone Number" field (string field).

title: STRY0007: Add "Job Title" Field to Contact Entry Page
iWantTo: Add a "Job Title" field to the form
soThat: I can enter the contact's job title
acceptanceCriteria: The Contact Entry Page includes a "Job Title" field (string field).

title: STRY0008: Add "Company/Organization" Field to Contact Entry Page
iWantTo: Add a "Company/Organization" field to the form
soThat: I can enter the contact's company name
acceptanceCriteria: The Contact Entry Page includes a "Company/Organization" field (string field).

iWantTo: Add a "Conference Session Attended" field to the form
soThat: I can enter the session the contact attended

iWantTo: Add a "Follow-Up Action" field to the form

iWantTo: Add a "Date/Time Met" field to the form
soThat: I can enter the date/time the contact was met

iWantTo: Add a "Tags/Interests" field to the form
soThat: I can enter tags or interests of the contact

iWantTo: Add a "Location Met" field to the form
soThat: I can enter the location where the contact was met

soThat: I can enter the event role of the contact

title: STRY0015: Configure Form Submission
iWantTo: Hit a button to save the information I've entered about a contact
soThat: The data is saved correctly in the table
acceptanceCriteria:
• The form captures input for all specified fields when you click "Submit".
  • Data is saved correctly in the ui_conference_notey table upon form submission.
hints: You're going to need to use a Data Resource for this. There's lots of types out there, try to find which is the best type for this use case.

title: STRY0016: Display Confirmation Message
iWantTo: See a display message upon form submission
soThat: I know the data has been successfully saved
acceptanceCriteria:
• A confirmation message is displayed after form submission.
  • The message confirms that the data has been saved.

title: STRY0017: Add "Create Another Entry" Button below confirmation message
iWantTo: See "Create another entry" button after the confirmation message
soThat: I can quickly add a new record after saving previous record
acceptanceCriteria:
• A "Create another entry" button appears after the confirmation message.
  • Clicking the button resets the form for a new entry.

title: STRY0018: L1 menu configuration
iWantTo: Be able to quickly access the Contact Entry Page
soThat: I can quickly create a new contact record
acceptanceCriteria: The L1 menu has a button below the home page button that directs to the Contact Entry Page.

title: STRY0019: Configure the UX list page
iWantTo: Click on a button to see who I haven't reached back out to
soThat: I can quickly see who I need to reach out to
acceptanceCriteria: The UX list page on the workspace displays another list under the "Contact" category, below "all" that shows only users that have the "Reached out to" checkbox unchecked.
hints: This configuration is not done inside of UI builder. Here is an example of it being done for a different workspace that might help you with this: [LINK]

title: STRY0020: Configure secondary items for contact record page
iWantTo: Be able to see some more information about the contact record at a glance
soThat: I can have more information handy without needing to scroll through the form
acceptanceCriteria: The following fields are displayed below the contact's name on the contact record page: organization, job title, event name.
hints: The Secondary Items component is in the header of the record page, under the Primary field label. This component gets its configuration from the form controller, but the secondary fields are picked outside of UI builder.

title: STRY0021: Create new "Contact tasks" table
iWantTo: Be able to assign myself tasks to do for each contact
soThat: I can keep track of what I have already done with the contact record
acceptanceCriteria: The contact tasks table should extend the Tasks table.

title: STRY0022: Add contact tasks related list to the contact record page
iWantTo: See a list of contact task records on the records page
soThat: I can see what my next steps are
acceptanceCriteria: The contact tasks table related list should display next to the details tab on the record page.

title: STRY0023: Landing Page configuration
iWantTo: Be able to see what pending tasks I might have at a glance
soThat: I can easily manage all my contacts in this app
acceptanceCriteria: Configure the landing page to have the following information: - total number of contacts, - number of contacts I haven't reached out to yet, - number of contacts I am waiting on. Include some reports on the number of contact tasks and what state they are in.

title: STRY0024: Configure "Greeting" notification
acceptanceCriteria: The email includes a thank-you message and the user's contact information.
hints: The notifications table sysevent_email_action is one of the ways you can configure email notifications. Try creating an email notification in there, and check out other records to see how fancy you can make it. You can use placeholders from the record, and do lots of fancy things.

title: STRY0025: Configure Automated Email Flow
iWantTo: Have an automated email that is configurable
soThat: An email is automatically sent to the contact's email address based on settings I configure including my digital contact info.
acceptanceCriteria:
• A flow is triggered upon creating a new contact record that does the following: (Feel free to add more)
  • Send the "Greeting" email to the contact's email address.
  • Create "follow-up" contact task in 1 week to remind the user to check if they received a response to the Greeting email. Add this information to the description of the contact task.
hints: Flow Designer lets you send off an email directly from there by using the "Send email" action, or you can use the "Send notification" action to select and send the notification you created in the previous story. It's good to familiarize yourself with both ways of working.

title: STRY0026: Create Scheduled Job
acceptanceCriteria: The scheduled job should run once a month, and should send user a report with any contacts where "Reached out" to is false.
hints: Scheduled jobs are older technology that you shouldn't really use, but it's important to be familiar with them regardless. Ideally moving forward you would do everything in a Flow, but it's good to familiarize yourself with Scheduled Jobs as it might be an interview question, or you could end up maintaining old Scheduled Jobs at your job.

title: STRY0027: Create "Conference App User" group
STRY0028: Assign "Conference App User" group the "x_snc_bam_you_i_0.user" role
hints: Always assign roles to a group and assign users to a group. Never assign roles directly to users.

title: STRY0030: Add Chuck Tomasi to "Conference App User" group
STRY0031: Create catalog item
acceptanceCriteria: Catalog item should be created to request access to the "Conference App User" group.
hints: You won't be able to access this through your workspace, and you won't find yourself using it at all, but you should be familiar with creating Catalog Items and this is an example of what they are used for.

title: STRY0032: Create SLA for contact tasks
acceptanceCriteria: When a contact task is created, have an SLA generate to remind the user to address the task. Remind the user once it reaches 30 days, 60 days, and 90 days.

title: STRY0033: Set number field to read only
hints: This is mostly just something I forgot to do, that would be smart for you to do.

title: STRY0034: Create application menu for unified navigation
STRY0035: Create application menu item for unified navigation to go directly to contacts table
STRY0036: Format the Phone Number field (server side)
acceptanceCriteria: The phone number entered in the field is appropriately formatted to a standard format. (You decide what the format is)
hints: You can do this in multiple ways, try them out and see which way works best for you. This story is meant to teach you how to work with Business Rules. Try figuring out how you can work with Business Rules to format the phone number field once the contact record has been submitted from the form. Bonus points if you learn what RegEx is. Business rules are used to do anything you want to a record as it is saved to the database. They can be executed in multiple ways, learn what they are.

title: STRY0037: Format the Phone Number field (client side)
hints: You can do this in multiple ways, try them out and see which way works best for you. You can either attempt this with a Client Script, or you might find a component that can do the work for you.

title: STRY0038: Duplicate email check
iWantTo: Check if there's a duplicate email already in the contacts table
hints: You can use a Client Script or a Business Rule for this functionality.
